newsitem.title: ISRAEL: U.S. envoy meets Netanyahu in Jerusalem.
newsitem.headline: U.S. envoy meets Netanyahu in Jerusalem.

text.p: U.S. President Bill Clinton's special envoy Dennis Ross met Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Friday hoping to resolve a crisis in Middle East peacemaking.

Israel's Foreign Minister David Levy and Defence Minister Yitzhak Mordechai were due to join the talks launched by Washington to end an impasse over a resurgence of Jewish settlement building and Palestinian guerrilla violence.
Earlier Ross met chief Palestinian peace negotiators Saeb Erekat and Mahmoud Abbas, also known as Abu Mazen.

Erekat said before their meeting the only way out of the crisis -- marked by nine days of clashes and an Islamist suicide bombing that killed three Israelis -- was for Israel to stop work on a Jewish settlement on a hilltop in Arab East Jerusalem.
"There is one item on the agenda: the current state of the peace process," Erekat told Reuters. "If Netanyahu orders the bulldozers to stop I think the peace process will be on track."

Asked whether Arafat's Palestinian Authority accepted Israel's demand it crack down on militants, Erekat said: "This has been our position, but we don't follow such demands by media lords like Netanyahu."
